segment.source: Local Video Playback
segment.target: Local Video Playback

segment.source: Local Video Playback
segment.target: Local Video Playback

segment.source: Local Video Playback
segment.target: Local Video Playback

segment.source: As part of the Battery Run Down job, the Local Video Playback assessment measures the usage rate of a computer’s battery during full-screen local video playback.
segment.target: As part of the Battery Run Down job, the Local Video Playback assessment measures the usage rate of a computer’s battery during full-screen local video playback.

segment.source: When playing full-screen local video, devices and software not necessary to deliver the video playback now use a minimal amount of energy, allowing for an even greater battery life.
segment.target: When playing full-screen local video, devices and software not necessary to deliver the video playback now use a minimal amount of energy, allowing for an even greater battery life.

segment.source: For more information about results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment.

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.
segment.target: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.

segment.source: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.
segment.target: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.

segment.source: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.
segment.target: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.

segment.source: If you run the Local Video Playback on a PC that has been upgraded from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1, you will be prompted to select a default program for playing MP4 files.
segment.target: If you run the Local Video Playback on a PC that has been upgraded from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1, you will be prompted to select a default program for playing MP4 files.

segment.source: This only affects PC that have been upgraded, and does not affect PCs with a clean Windows 8.1 installation.
segment.target: This only affects PC that have been upgraded, and does not affect PCs with a clean Windows 8.1 installation.

segment.source: To run the assessment, choose the default video player when prompted.
segment.target: To run the assessment, choose the default video player when prompted.

segment.source: Or you can change the default program that opens MP4 files by using the Control Panel.
segment.target: Or you can change the default program that opens MP4 files by using the Control Panel.

segment.source: From the Search Charm, type Change the file type associated with a file extension.
segment.target: From the Search Charm, type Change the file type associated with a file extension.

segment.source: Open the Control Panel.
segment.target: Open the Control Panel.

segment.source: Choose the .mp4 extension and click Change Program.
segment.target: Choose the .mp4 extension and click Change Program.

segment.source: Select the default program you want to use to play MP4 files.
segment.target: Select the default program you want to use to play MP4 files.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: The computer must have a default media player set that is capable of playing MP4-encoded content.
segment.target: The computer must have a default media player set that is capable of playing MP4-encoded content.

segment.source: The computer must be capable of playing a 1080p video.
segment.target: The computer must be capable of playing a 1080p video.

segment.source: The computer must be running on DC (battery) power.
segment.target: The computer must be running on DC (battery) power.

segment.source: Energy efficiency jobs are designed to run only on mobile devices.
segment.target: Energy efficiency jobs are designed to run only on mobile devices.

segment.source: If a battery is not detected, you will receive an error.
segment.target: If a battery is not detected, you will receive an error.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Before you begin, configure the settings on the computer to create the most realistic scenario possible, reducing the risk of generating warnings in the results.
segment.target: Before you begin, configure the settings on the computer to create the most realistic scenario possible, reducing the risk of generating warnings in the results.

segment.source: The following guidelines are recommended settings.
segment.target: The following guidelines are recommended settings.

segment.source: They are not required for the job to run, but the results may be adversely affected if the computer is not appropriately configured.
segment.target: They are not required for the job to run, but the results may be adversely affected if the computer is not appropriately configured.

segment.source: Make sure that your computer is running in Airplane mode.
segment.target: Make sure that your computer is running in Airplane mode.

segment.source: Exit all non-essential running applications.
segment.target: Exit all non-essential running applications.

segment.source: Set the screen brightness to at least 75% (200 nits).
segment.target: Set the screen brightness to at least 75% (200 nits).

segment.source: Install and enable antivirus software.
segment.target: Install and enable antivirus software.

segment.source: If antivirus software isn't enabled and running, the results might not reflect realistic scenarios.
segment.target: If antivirus software isn't enabled and running, the results might not reflect realistic scenarios.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Action Center, choose Security, and check that the Virus protection is On.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Action Center, choose Security, and check that the Virus protection is On.

segment.source: If not, choose Change Action Center Settings and then choose the Virus protection check box.
segment.target: If not, choose Change Action Center Settings and then choose the Virus protection check box.

segment.source: Make sure that the power policy is set to Balanced.
segment.target: Make sure that the power policy is set to Balanced.

segment.source: By default, any other power policy generates a warning that may affect the results.
segment.target: By default, any other power policy generates a warning that may affect the results.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Power Options, and then choose Balanced.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Power Options, and then choose Balanced.

segment.source: Make sure that the computer is configured so that a password isn't required when the computer resumes from a screen saver.
segment.target: Make sure that the computer is configured so that a password isn't required when the computer resumes from a screen saver.

segment.source: Make sure that all device drivers are correctly installed.
segment.target: Make sure that all device drivers are correctly installed.

segment.source: Results might vary significantly if your computer has missing or incorrect drivers.
segment.target: Results might vary significantly if your computer has missing or incorrect drivers.

segment.source: You can use the Driver Verification assessment to identify driver issues on the computer that you want to assess.
segment.target: You can use the Driver Verification assessment to identify driver issues on the computer that you want to assess.

segment.source: For best results, we recommend that you run the job as a packaged job.
segment.target: For best results, we recommend that you run the job as a packaged job.

segment.source: For information about how to create and run a packaged job, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For information about how to create and run a packaged job, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.source: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows RT 8.1
segment.target: Windows RT 8.1

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.

segment.source: You can run this assessment on a Windows RT 8.1 system in either of the following ways:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on a Windows RT 8.1 system in either of the following ways:

segment.source: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console, and then run it on Windows RT 8.1.
segment.target: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console, and then run it on Windows RT 8.1.

segment.source: For more information about this option, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For more information about this option, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: Use Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: Use Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.
